page.title: 10SUNBANK PARK LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: Sunbank Park used to be a quarry. In March 1972 the council started talking about rehabilitating the quarry and turning it into a park. In June 1974 work began. Altogether the total cost for building the park was seventy-four thousand pounds. The park was opened to the public on 2nd of May, 1975. It comprises 2 ponds, a lake and a parking area. Most of the ground is covered with stones which makes it almost impossible for grass to grow. We questioned people living in our area about Sunbank Park. To the public Sunbank is not safe and quite a few people said the ponds should be drained. Most think it is too close to the main road, especially as there are no pavements. It was felt that it would be used a lot more if it was better signposted.
